summary: This bill amends Title 4 of the United States Code to mandate that funeral honor details recite the 13 Folds of Honor during the presentation of the U.S. flag at the funerals of members of the Armed Forces and veterans. The bill outlines the specific recitation for each fold and includes an exception allowing the next of kin or designated agent to opt out. The bill also includes a sense of Congress statement dedicating the act to the service members killed in the Kabul airport attack in 2021.
